text.p: - Russian-German space team, scheduled to set off on Monday, is under a risk as it will be carried by a rocket the launching of which has been banned and will be taken back to earth by a ageing spacecraft.
- It is better to sit and talk for years then to fight says Russia's security Ivan Rybkin about a new stage of relations between Russia and Chechnya.
- Red Cross has recalled its mission from Tajikistan. The journalists, taken hostage on Wednesday, may be freed today.
- Russia's Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin is expected to clarify the question of president Boris Yeltsin's health while meeting U.S. president Bill Clinton.
- Violence against people carrying out their professional duties in hot spots of the former Soviet Union is becoming a monstrous reality of the post-Soviet era.
- The emergence of a new political group, splitting up the parliament's left wing majoirity, was announced on Thursday.
- Russia's prime minister is invited to meet top millitary officials next week to discuss a dramatic situation in the army.
- Infantine mortality statistics show that in Russia every 17th new-born baby out of a thousand dies.
